p: A study of the effect of mānuka oil on different life stages of D. gallinae suggests it is effective against both adult and juvenile mites but that it is not ovicidal for this parasite [ 58]. A study of the effect of mānuka oil on D. gallinae found the lethal concentration required to kill 50% of the parasites (LC 50) during a 24-h period in a contact bioassay was ~0.05 mg/cm 3 and 0.03 mg/cm 3 [ 58]. Mānuka oil displayed a repelling effect on >75% of D. gallinae mites for up to 4 days after treatment of the mites contained in the Y-tube of an olfactometer and exposed to either fresh air in one arm of the Y-tube or air containing the volatile components of each essential oil in the other arm [ 59, 62].
